title: For everyone coming to Ekko's rescue...
body:
I would like to pose a test for you. To everyone running about the boards trying to put out fires relating to the newest champion, Ekko, claiming that his kit is fine, that he isn't the first champion to be released with an overloaded kit, and even tossing up Elise's icon like it actually means something, let's see if you can just answer a quick question. If you can give a decent answer then I'll gladly concede the argument, but I want to know:

What is your idea of counter-play to Ekko post-6?

That's all. I want you to tell me how I'm expected to outplay/counter him post-level 6, because right now I'm drawing a blank. I want anyone to give an explanation, a play-by-play, whatever, to let the community know how to deal with Ekko, because I can see people are having trouble.

replies.body:
I guess major problem is the ult.
"Gotta tower dive? dash for the in, Q to close the escaping route , damage damage and R to warp back to safety. "
"Oh, got ganked! So let's try stun... dash.. well, it didn't work, so R YAY"
"Dueling.. if he tries to kill me  he will A) Risk taking the opressive damage from the ult a try to burst me while I got a a heal, or B) Think I won't active the ult a chase my ghost".
"B... full life shopped... and I'm back with R. Clearing the turret wave"

Too much utility, too much damage.

Utility is great, but if you don't pay the price you crowd out other picks. I can't see diana being viable while ekko has better AOE damage  and two possible escape routes.

What is you problem exactly?
Are you worried about the ult damage?
If so, you have got a clone of him following him around telling where the explosion will land

Are you worried about the "oops, i screwed up" reset?
I myself don't think that's a problem, he barely gains any health back unless you're playing a burst mage. And if so, don't forget Ekko's ult has a long ass cooldown, so you can outplay him around that

The rest of his kit? Not that deadly
His stun has a 3 second delay, so it should be easy to dodge it

The thing is, he may be strong, but unlike other champions, he has counter-play, and a lot of it at that

Okay, I spy a couple of problems with this.

1. You can only see his trail if you have vision on Ekko himself.
2. It's 4 full seconds, which is more than enough time for people other than burst-mages to take him down.
3. His kit is absolutely deadly. His Q has a combined scaling of .8. His E Has good base damage and can proc Lich Bane.

Also, his W may have a 3 second delay, but _"Enemies do not gain vision of the target area until the last 0.5 seconds."_ Not only that, but even if you do know where he casted the ability, you still have to move out of it, and unless you're someone with a dash, that's at least 1.5 seconds you're spending running away from him that he's spending beating you down, so you've already lost the duel. If you stay in the field to fight, he stuns you and you die anyway.

I did say I'd concede if someone gave me reasonable counterplay, but what you're describing doesn't even begin to qualify.

> You can only see his trail if you have vision on Ekko himself.

How can you not see Ekko if you are fighting him?

> It's 4 full seconds, which is more than enough time for people other than burst-mages to take him down.

My apologies, but i don't get what you mean

> His kit is absolutely deadly. His Q has a combined scaling of .8. His E Has good base damage and can proc Lich Bane.

Yea now imagine he only has Aether wisp and maybe boots. Not as deadly now. From what i've seen, you only get hit by the 2 Q's if you don't even try to dodge. Everyone deals good damage with a Lich Bane

> his W may have a 3 second delay, but "Enemies do not gain vision of the target area until the last 0.5 seconds."

But you can see him cast it. You can see the clone throwing the time bomb, so unless he goes all the way back to his tower, you will have vision on him

Many people have already made great point in this thread, so i will not repeat them

> Many people have already made great point in this thread, so i will not repeat them

Uh, no? Two other arguments for Ekko have been stated. One of them is, "I saw a pro player beat him once" and, "You're bad if you lose to this champ".

Those aren't "great arguments".

> My apologies, but i don't get what you mean

4 seconds is a good amount of time for ANYONE to beat the shit out of Ekko, aside from perhaps supports. Not just burst mages.

> But you can see him cast it. You can see the clone throwing the time bomb, so unless he goes all the way back to his tower, you will have vision on him

As I already said, that doesn't matter. If he casts it, he wins the fight. Whether you run from him or stay to fight, you lose the fight. It's a catch-.22.

> Yea now imagine he only has Aether wisp and maybe boots. Not as deadly now. From what i've seen, you only get hit by the 2 Q's if you don't even try to dodge. Everyone deals good damage with a Lich Bane

This is such a flawed argument I'm not even going to comment.

> As I already said, that doesn't matter. If he casts it, he wins the fight. Whether you run from him or stay to fight, you lose the fight. It's a catch-.22.

Not at all. Most Ekko's are hilariously predictable. If you're running, they'll throw it to intercept you. If you're fighting, they'll throw it on top of themselves. Just move a few units and resume. If you were that low to where 1 second of movement would kill you, then him throwing the W wouldn't matter. 

Incidently, his weaknesses are sustained battles. At his core, he's still an assassin. He wants to run in, dump his damage, and run out. He doesn't have the durabiltiy to withstand prolonged conflicts, so he tends to falter against champions that can withstand burst and then return fire, or champions with enough cc to keep him locked down anyway. For midlane, I'd recommend Annie, Swain, Zyra, Viktor, Mordekaiser, Diana, Anivia (skill based), and Brand (skill based).

So are you saying that you have to hope that he misplays in order to beat him outside of a sustained fight (assuming he's not already fed off your team)?

That's kind of fucked up, don't you think?

Honestly? That IS the ideal. As much as I hate to use the example, look at any pro match. Very rarely does it come out to who is more skilled. Most often, it simply boils down to who makes a mistake first.

And to my knowledge, that's the kind of level people want to achieve. After a certain point, you and your opponent are going to be of the same strength. Unless its a horrible mismatch, it becomes more and more of capitalizing on your opponent's errors.

But that's a bit higher than most people. So for options that YOU can do, just make sure to play smart, not hard. Ekko may be strong, but he's only as good as the person using him. If he throws Q on you, back away. If he follows up with E, turn around and engage him. If he winds up for W, predict where it will go. Keep his ult's location in mind, keep fighting him, but don't stay in one spot and do it.

> Ekko may be strong, but he's only as good as the person using him.

Incorrect. He's better. The amount of utility he has on his kit and the nature of his ultimate means he he doesn't just have to make A mistake, he has to make two. At LEAST two. You can play Ekko very poorly and still kick the shit out of the enemy team. I know because it's happened to me. I could point out mistakes and poor plays the enemy Ekko was making, but it didn't matter because my teammates were still melting under his burst and unable to catch him afterward.

That's not necessarily true. Veigar also has an AoE stun that doesn't require him to be in it. He doesn't win fights by throwing it in the middle. Also, his W is VERY obvious. You have to honestly be chasing him through the jungle to not notice his projection casting it.

Well I saw Bjerg absolutely dumpster an Ekko in lane going 6-0 as Viktor last night despite getting heavily camped by the enemy jungle and support.  I don't think he's quite as strong as people are letting on.  Folks like to exaggerate on here.

Wait so your saying one of the best pro Mid laners used a champion hes been playing for years and wrecked someone playing a champion that came out 6 hours prior to the fight?  I don't think thats a good guage for Ekkos power, plus if you think about viktor, hes kind of a great counter for Ekko. He can keep his distance, shield himself when Ekko tries to burst, lay his gravity field inside Ekkos chronoshpere effectivly making it useless bc he cant get the shield w.o getting stunned and he cant engage a stunned viktor in it without also getting stunned. Im sure by mid game viktors lazer was chunking half of Ekkos health too.  

Hes certainly being exaggurated but he is very strong. Too many people carrying with this "High skill floor" champion on day 1. His floor is pretty low, you really just have to poke with q until there at half health (Roughly 2 double hits) and then E them to bring them under 30% and smack em with an auto and there dead.

Seems to me like you either have to play brand and somewhat predict his movements, or play another assassin and abandon the lane at 6 to roam. Neither of these options are 100% guarantees of success and the avenues should not be this limited. Get rid of his stun field, the dash, and tweak a few numbers and he would actually be okay as a champion. Right now though he bursts worse than a full build talon, has four times as much crowd control, and is more safe than zed in his kit. Riot took everything that the community has been complaining about and rolled it into one champion. Disgusting.

interesting, the amount of people who cannot avoid a DELAYED ult to a SPECIFIC point that you can SEE is surprisingly high. i guess the only thing that should change is the B-R combo with homeguard, its a little ridiculus especially if a fight is around the place you recalled.

This is pretty much the same question as what you do against <insert assassin X here> post 6, where X is {{champion:103}} {{champion:238}} {{champion:7}} {{champion:84}} etc., and the answer is still the same.
Essentially, the complaint is "X has ridiculous damage, insane mobility, and a totally unfair ult that lets them 100-0 me without any danger to themselves." That's pretty much been true of any assassin, on the most basic level. 
But, unless you've lost every game you've ever played against an assassin, you know that you can beat them with CC, tankiness, good positioning, baiting their combo, etc. etc.
Nerfs incoming, I'm sure. New champs are mostly OP so people will play them a lot and Rito will know how to nerf them. But I'm still gonna take my Cho'gath mid lane and stomp the newest assassin X with natural tankiness, CC, and sustain.

I have to disagree on Akali's ult. It actually puts her in a tremendous amount of danger compared to the other 3 on your list. Proper usage of her shroud is difficult, but it does a great job of mitigating said damage...but can be countered by {{item:2043}}

Farm! Freeze the lane at your end, and he will burn mana trying to farm with Q instead of farming with last hits. His mobility is for engaging, so you can get free hits if he last hits minions with melee, and he can't safely dive you with only E.
Also, if you push to his side, he can overlap his ulti on you to deal massive burst, but if the lane is near your turret, he has to save ulti for dives or to retreat from ganks, losing a lot of damage. Don't aim for the kill, he is a very safe champion, out farm him and force him to recall or build mana instead of damage.

Place wards in your jungle as he roams quite easily, if he does roam, and you know where the jungleer is, follow him. If he engages bot and needs to escape, stay near (no on) his shadow for free finishing blows. If he is running away, DON'T Chase, he jukes worse than wukong and Yasuo. I baited the enemy team around the entire map (I was back door bot, ran to drake, hoped over wall, went to inner mid turret, went top passed baron, then returned safely to my lane. My team tried to help and died like fools, but I had the enemy team chasing me for about 1/2 minutes while I was dealing damage with Ulti and poke. my ulti actually came off cd, that's how long they chased me for. 

If you don't have MR or he's ahead, don't dual him. He will try to slyly place his stun over you, and he can ulti on the spot for massive burst. Poke and retreat, hit him while he farms, he has no sustain, so he has no way to get that HP back, unless he wants to waste ulti. Mana regen doesn't synergise with his kit well, bait his skill shots and dodge them, if he is low on mana he can only recall, as he can't even use ulti to escape anymore. 

If you are ahead, let the wave push, then go aggro on him. force him to ulti early and he won't even be able to last hit a couple minions, he will be forced to recall entirely, Fiora is good at this. If he goes top, Fiora and Darius (if played really well) can punish him, panth as well, if he is mid, most assassins like LB will be able to bait and punish him for trying to farm, and stop him snowballing. 

Haven't gone up against a yas yet, but Zed and Lb should beat him. 

So yeah, biggest tip, like with Kata, watch out for his roaming, and cut off his farm, he will become useless. Late game and team fights he is very strong, so get ahead, DO NOT DIVE, if anything, roam yourself if your lane is pushed. Deny him farm, deny early kills, and get ahead with good map awareness and stop him from reaching Nasus-level late game, as his full build is oppressive, and hard cc followed by high burst is your only chance at taking him out. 
And like singed, Do Not Chase

My counter is to pick {{champion:45}}, toss my stun up where he wants to / has to go, and then delete him before he gets a chance to ult. Plus, if Ekko tries to waveclear, you get much more chance to farm Q properly. 

If Ekko E's to you, you just got a free Q on him and possibly your EW combo as well (and R if it's post-6). 

If veigar gets a RoA first + some MR item like a Chalice, Ekko can't really do all that much to stop him from farming and you can take potshots at Ekko who, having built damage, will end up getting chunked if you hit him.
